reviews.text:
Stood waiting to check-in for an hour and a half. I've stayed at other Britannia hotels before, but for some reason, this one seems to struggle with check-in.
Room was clean and we had a big king size bed, but no window in the room and it was stuffy and hot, no TV remote or remote for the air-con.

Small rooms, dark, elevator broken, was notified breakfast had changed times to earlier despite all signage stating otherwise, dirty and noisy. Honestly the absolute worst hotel I've ever stayed in. 1 star is too good.

SHAMEFUL!
this place was disgusting me and my husband shared a luxury room ðŸ™„ which turned out not only the surprise of bed bugs but the dust when sat down i highly doubt the sheets are clean and changed regularly. but not to mention the big pice of black hair on my pillow and more in the food! the food was ok but cold and so was the shower was full of hair and bugs
WILL NOT COME BACK !!!!

If I could give no stars I would. My daughter and I wanted to treat ourselves to a mini break away. I found the hotel, she arrived before me. She calls and want impressed at all. The bed sheets were very dirty, the shower curtain had green marks on it. The bag has stains It. The windows were just horrible. It was like stepping into a time machine,. Only one lift was working and we were put on a smoking floor. We Do No Smoke. We just couldn't stay, I booked another hotel just for the peace of mind and left. We didn't get a refund that was last of our worries. We will not be going back there again. They need to either shut it down or re do it up.
they let me steal stuff was great
